SENTENCE.STRING: (4,219 m) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland.
lies towards the northern end of the Nadelgrat, a high-level ridge running roughly northâ€“south above the resort of Saas-Fee to the east, and the Mattertal to the west.
was first climbed by R. B. Heathcote, with guides Franz Biner, Peter Perren and Peter Taugwalderon, in August 1869 via the west gully above the Hohberg Glacier to the Stecknadeljoch.
north-east face, not as long or as steep as that on the neighbouring Lenzspitze, is 320 m and at an average angle of 50 degrees, and might be considered as excellent training for the latter.
